task_summary: Detect the pink cloth, grasp one edge with a pinch, lift slightly, pull to fold, place it down, release, lightly push to flatten, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A PR2-like manipulator folds a small pink cloth lying on a wooden table. The robot first perceives the cloth, approaches from above, and aligns. It forms a pinch grasp on an edge, lifts the edge, and translates laterally to fold the cloth onto itself. It then lowers until contact with the table, releases the grasp, optionally applies a short push to flatten the fold, and retreats clear of the workspace. The sequence aims to be gentle and precise to avoid wrinkling or slipping.
preconditions: Cloth is visible on the table
stepwise_plan: Detect the cloth and move above it at safe clearance.
Align precisely and open the gripper.
Compute a pinch grasp on a cloth edge and pick.
Lift slightly and translate laterally to fold.
Lower until contact, release, then push briefly to flatten.
success_criteria: Cloth appears halved with edges aligned
Gripper ends empty and above table
failure_and_recovery: Detection fails → retry detection up to 3 times.
Grasp slips → re-align and re-grasp after opening.
Cloth drags excessively → reduce lateral distance or reattempt with smaller lift.
Contact not detected → extend lowering depth within safe bounds.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the gripper has released the cloth, optional flattening push is complete, and the arm has retreated.

frame_3.now_evidence: Gripper establishes first secure contact near the cloth edge; geometry suggests imminent lifting.
frame_3.predicts_next: A vertical lift followed by lateral translation to create the fold.

node_specs.description: Perceive the cloth; retried up to 3 times.
Move to a pregrasp height above the cloth.
Align precisely over the grasp edge.
Plan a pinch at the cloth edge.
Execute pinch grasp on cloth edge.
Translate laterally to fold the cloth.
Light push to flatten the fold.

recovery_strategy: Increase lowering depth within safe bounds
assumptions: Folding is approximated by lateral translation while grasping one edge; no dedicated 'fold' primitive exists. Direction chosen along table x-axis based on frames. Optional flattening push inferred from final configuration.

expected_success_criteria: Final cloth footprint smaller than initial
